messages.title: How 'local' is the Conservative candidate?
messages.content: Questions raised about the local engagement and origins of the Conservative candidate.

messages.title: Mark delivers Relief Road
messages.content: Highlighting the candidate's delivery on the Relief Road.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Mark Hunter campaigns for £8bn for local NHS and investment for Stepping Hill Hospital and Wythenshawe Hospital and St Ann's Hospice.

issues.economy: References to concerns about the current government handling of the economy.
issues.health: Mark Hunter fights for Stepping Hill Hospital, Wythenshawe Hospital and St Ann’s Hospice. Labour and Tories refuse to commit to doctors' £8bn NHS funding plea.

endorsements.endorser: Councillor Paul Porgess of Cheadle North ward
endorsements.endorsement: Marks Hunter has been an effective and enthusiastic city Rep. I am happy to say he gets my vote.

endorsements.endorser: Norman Lamb, Minister of State for Care and Support
endorsements.endorsement: Everyone working with the NHS cherishes services like Stepping Hill Hospital and St Ann’s Hospice.

quotes.text: Everyone working with the NHS cherishes services like Stepping Hill Hospital and St Ann’s Hospice.
quotes.source: Norman Lamb, Minister of State for Care and Support

images.caption: Mark Hunter with healthcare professionals and Norman Lamb at a local hospital.
